page.title: 16Desborough
page.content: Desborough is a small town of some 6000 people situated on the main London road The part covered by the survey is separated from the town centre by the A.6 road.Many old buildings have been demolished in recent years to make way for road improvements.One of the most important factors in Desborough's development has been the Co-operative movement which extended its influence into all aspects of life.At one time it owned ironstone quarries and still makes corsets as well as operating retail shops.In the last 20 years there has been considerable housing develop- ment towards Braybrooke.A new school was opened in 1974.Some industrial development has taken place on the fringes of our area.The football club caters for social and leisure activities.
